pullRequest.title: Created base assembly for Pantheon Help.
pullRequest.bodyText: Covers the content identified as part of Release 1 for the product documentation, including comment stubs for modules yet to be added.

commit.message: Created base assembly for Pantheon Help.

nodes.bodyText:
requirements and, => requirements, and
I saw that Ashwin used an attribute for a placeholder for "Pantheon". Should we all be doing that?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@
+ifdef::context[:parent-context: {context}]
+
+include::../attributes.adoc[]
+
+[id="help"]
+= Help
+
+:context: assembly-pantheon-help
+
+Welcome to Pantheon help.
+
+This document describes the main concepts, requirements and, actions in Pantheon.

nodes.bodyText: I believe Ingrid guides us to avoid intro sentences like this that don't really add any value.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@
+ifdef::context[:parent-context: {context}]
+
+include::../attributes.adoc[]
+
+[id="help"]
+= Help
+
+:context: assembly-pantheon-help
+
+Welcome to Pantheon help.
+
+This document describes the main concepts, requirements and, actions in Pantheon.
+
+include::modules/con_about_pantheon.adoc[leveloffset=+1]
+
+// Section 1
+== Modular documentation
+
+This section describes modular documentation.

nodes.bodyText:
Maybe just make the section heading more descriptive and get rid of this sentence?
== Concepts => == Pantheon Concepts
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@
+ifdef::context[:parent-context: {context}]
+
+include::../attributes.adoc[]
+
+[id="help"]
+= Help
+
+:context: assembly-pantheon-help
+
+Welcome to Pantheon help.
+
+This document describes the main concepts, requirements and, actions in Pantheon.
+
+include::modules/con_about_pantheon.adoc[leveloffset=+1]
+
+// Section 1
+== Modular documentation
+
+This section describes modular documentation.
+
+include::modules/con_what-is-a-module.adoc[leveloffset=+2]
+
+include::modules/con_comparison-between-modules-and-DITA-topics.adoc[leveloffset=+2]
+
+// Section 2
+include::modules/ref_prerequisites.adoc[leveloffset=+1]
+
+// Section 3
+== Concepts
+
+This section describes the main concepts required to understand and use Pantheon.

commit.message: Updated the main help assembly in accordance with feedback from peer review.
Added anchor IDs to each section in the main help assembly.
